artefact: Get a birthday or anniversary message from the Queen

artefact.overview: Get a message from the Queen ('telegram from the Queen'), including which birthdays and anniversaries qualify and what documents you need to apply
artefact.body:
Apply to Buckingham Palace to get a free birthday or anniversary message from the Queen - only certain birthdays and anniversaries count and you’ll need to send proof.

  1. Fill in an application form below and send a copy of your birth certificate or wedding certificate - the address is on the form.

  2. Apply no earlier than 3 weeks before the celebration date.

  3. You can get a belated message up to 6 months later.

Download an application form for a birthday message (PDF, 314KB) Download an application form for a wedding anniversary message (PDF, 317KB)

Birthdays and anniversaries that count

Birthdays you can get a message for:

  • 100th birthday
  • 105th birthday
  • each year following your 105th birthday

Wedding anniversaries you can get a message for:

  • 60th (diamond)
  • 65th
  • 70th (platinum)
  • each year following your 70th anniversary

If you live abroad

You need to show evidence of your British nationality.

If you live in Australia, Canada or New Zealand send the completed application form to your Governor-General.
